docs.title: Techniques overview
docs.text:
Versioned recipes with Pool / Max labels. Pick a technique, compare versions, and start building.

  • Acrylic base
  • Carbon layup
  • Glue fin rails
  • Surface finish
  • Flex test rig
  • Buoyancy test

docs.title: Acrylic base — compare versions
docs.text: Version Use Status Maturity Cost Tooling Time Pros Tradeoffs v2 acrylic + wedges Pool Active Stable Low Low Short Light, cheap, fast Can bow if over‑clamped v1 wood support Pool Active Stable Medium Low Medium Very stiff Heavy, bulky

docs.title: Acrylic base v1 — wood support
docs.text: Use when you need maximum stiffness and already have MDF.

docs.title: Acrylic base v2 — acrylic + plastic wedges
docs.text: Process is the same for all fin sizes. Dimensions depend on the specific project.

docs.title: Buoyancy test v1: pool setup
docs.text: Basic procedure for checking buoyancy using a pool test.

docs.title: Carbon layup — compare versions
docs.text: Version Use Status Maturity Cost Tooling Time Pros Tradeoffs v1 linear taper Pool Active Stable Medium Medium Medium Simple, repeatable Not the lightest

docs.title: Carbon layup v1 — linear taper
docs.text: Baseline recipe with 0/90 twill and simple taper.

docs.title: Carbon layup v2: future project
docs.text: Details to be determined.

docs.title: Flex test rig v1: basic rig
docs.text: Span 500 mm; loads 10 kg and 15 kg; dial indicator at tip. Record deflection for comparison.

docs.title: Glue fin rails — compare versions
docs.text: Version Use Status Maturity Cost Tooling Time Pros Tradeoffs v1 PU adhesive Pool/Max Active Stable Low Low Short Flexible, accessible Longer full cure

docs.title: Glue fin rails v1 — polyurethane adhesive
docs.text: Rubber rails, light clamp pressure, full cure overnight.

docs.title: Materials suppliers
docs.text: Category Supplier Notes Carbon fabrics Soller Composites Wide range of twill and UD Epoxy systems Easy Composites Low‑viscosity epoxies Vacuum supplies Fibre Glast Bag film, peel ply, breather Rails Various Shore A ~70 rails

docs.title: Materials datasheets
docs.text: Upload PDFs here for quick reference (resins, fabrics, adhesives).

docs.title: Neck weight — compare versions
docs.text: Version Use Status Maturity Cost Tooling Time Pros Tradeoffs v2 molded sleeve Pool Active Stable Low Low Medium Clean, snag‑free Slight buoyancy v1 shot in inner tube Pool Active Stable Low Low Short Fast, cheapest Potential leaks

docs.title: Neck weight v1 — shot in inner tube
docs.text: Cheap, tool‑light build; sleeve the tube for safety.

docs.title: Neck weight v2 — molded sleeve
docs.text: Encapsulated core, smooth finish, front quick‑release.

docs.title: Surface finish — compare versions
docs.text: Version Use Status Maturity Cost Tooling Time Pros Tradeoffs v1 peel‑ply texture Pool Active Stable Low Low Short Matte, low weight Less glossy

docs.title: Surface finish v1 — peel‑ply texture
docs.text: Clean, matte finish straight from the bag; very light.
